benchmark_details.name: SKA-Bench (Structured Knowledge Augmented QA Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: SKA-Bench is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate the structured knowledge understanding capabilities of large language models (LLMs) through a fine-grained approach, encompassing different types of structured knowledge such as knowledge graphs and tables.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive and rigorous evaluation for LLMs in understanding structured knowledge.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: SKA-Bench is limited to English only and does not yet capture the performances of LLMs in understanding structured knowledge across multiple languages.

data.source: A collection of structured knowledge augmented QA instances generated from various existing datasets such as WebQSP, CWQ, WTQ, and others.
data.annotation: Manual annotation performed by domain experts to identify positive and noisy knowledge units.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the agreement between predicted answers and gold answers.
methodology.interpretation: A higher F1 Score indicates better performance in understanding structured knowledge.
methodology.validation: Empirical evaluations conducted on multiple LLMs to assess their understanding capabilities through various testbeds.
